events.message: The policyholder reported an auto accident involving their vehicle that occurred on the morning of April 30. They provided initial details about the collision with another car at an intersection.
The claim was reviewed and categorized under Auto Accident after confirming that the incident involved a collision between two vehicles.
An insurance agent specialized in auto claims was assigned to manage the case and contact the claimant for further information.
The claimant received confirmation that their auto accident claim was officially acknowledged and is now under active review by the insurance company.
The insurance company requested additional documentation, including the police report, photos of the damaged car, and medical bills related to the accident.
The claimant submitted all requested documents, including the police accident report and detailed photographs of the vehicle damages.
The claim investigation was initiated with a detailed review of the submitted documents and contacting the other party involved in the collision.
The investigation concluded that the claimant was not at fault and damages were consistent with the collision descriptions and evidence.
The insurer proposed a settlement amount covering the vehicle repairs and medical expenses resulting from the accident.
The claimant responded positively to the proposed settlement, expressing satisfaction with the prompt communication and fair offer.
Following positive feedback, the claim was officially approved to proceed with payment for the vehicle damage and associated costs.
The insurance payout was processed and issued to the claimant, covering all approved costs related to the auto accident claim.
The claim was officially closed after confirming the claimant received payment and no further follow-up was needed regarding the vehicle accident.
The closed case was archived in the insurance records system as completed auto accident claim for future reference if needed.
